attributes.action: Carry out a check of the Brexit result BEFORE Article 50 declaration
attributes.additional_details: The media information regarding the cost savings to be had by leaving EU was   publicised that the weekly cost of being in the EU was £350 million per week before rebates . The result was in fact a net obligation to the EU of £136 million per week. This sum whilst appearing large to the man in the street is insignificant when one considers the weekly cost of the UK pension payments stated at £92 billion - that is just under £2 BILLION per week. As a percentage the EU cost 6.8 % of pension cost
attributes.background:
I believe :-

(a) that the Brexit vote in June 2016 was as a result of misinformation and /or misstatement of the facts by those favoring a "leave" result.  

(b) that it's incumbent upon the government to effectively review/check the wishes of the population now that the facts are now clearer

rejection.details: It's not clear how you would like the Government or Parliament to check the wishes of the population. Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
